page.title: 14SEDGEFIELD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: THE PARISH CHURCH WAS NAMED AFTER {ST EDMUND.}THE NAVE OF THE CHURCH WAS BUILT BETWEEN 1246 AND 1256.THE CHANCEL AND THE SOUTH TRANSEPT WERE BUILT BETWEEN 1290 AND 1300.THE NORTH TRANSEPT WAS BUILT BETWEEN 1320 AND 1330.THE TOWER WHICH IS 90 FT HIGH WAS BUILT IN 1490 AND IS THE TALLEST CHURCH TOWER IN THE COUNTY.THE MOST INTERESTING FEATURES OF THE CHURCH ARE THE THREE BRASSES.ONE IS ON A FLOOR GRAVE AND IS OF A HELMET DATING FROM 1445.THE OTHER TWO ARE ON THE WALLS. THE OLDEST BRASS IS OF A KNEELING LADY DATING FROM 1310.THIS WAS STOLEN IN 1968 BUT WAS FOUND AGAIN IN 1972.THE THIRD IS A PAIR OF SHROUD BRASSES DATING FROM ABOUT 1470.
